description: Assesses General Knowledge, Arts, and History for 11th/12th-grade students in the Arts stream pursuing Mass Communication to guide academic and career choices.

questions.question_text: Which Indian body regulates the media industry, including television and radio?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting regulates media. Regulatory knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (Media Policy).

questions.question_text: Which Indian city is considered the hub of the Bollywood film industry?
questions.explanation: Mumbai is the hub of Bollywood. Industry knowledge is key for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: Which global platform is known for its role in citizen journalism, like Twitter/X?
questions.explanation: Twitter/X enables citizen journalism. Social media knowledge supports Mass Communication (Digital Media).

questions.question_text: Which Indian newspaper is known as ‘The Times of India’?
questions.explanation: The Times of India is a leading newspaper. Print media knowledge is vital for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: Which Indian institute is renowned for journalism courses, like IIMC?

options.text: All India Institute of Medical Sciences

questions.explanation: IIMC is renowned for journalism. Institutional knowledge is key for Mass Communication aspirants.

questions.question_text: Which country is home to the BBC, a global leader in broadcasting?
questions.explanation: The BBC is based in the UK. Global media knowledge supports Mass Communication (Broadcast Journalism).

questions.question_text: What does the acronym ‘DD’ stand for in Indian broadcasting?
questions.explanation: DD stands for Doordarshan, India’s public broadcaster. Broadcasting knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (Television).

questions.question_text: Which Indian state is known for its vibrant regional film industry, like Tollywood?
questions.explanation: Telangana’s Tollywood is a major film industry. Regional media knowledge is key for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: Which social media platform is primarily used for professional networking?
questions.explanation: LinkedIn is for professional networking. Digital media knowledge is vital for Mass Communication (Social Media).

questions.question_text: Which Indian news channel is known for its slogan ‘Nation Wants to Know’?
questions.explanation: Times Now uses ‘Nation Wants to Know’. Television media knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (Broadcast Journalism).

questions.question_text: What is the primary role of a journalist?
questions.explanation: Journalists report news ethically. Journalism knowledge is crucial for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: What is the term for a brief introduction to a news story?
questions.explanation: The lead introduces a news story. Writing knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (News Writing).

questions.question_text: What is the primary focus of public relations?
questions.explanation: Public relations manages public image. PR knowledge is key for Mass Communication (Public Relations).

questions.question_text: Which Indian journalist is known for investigative reporting, like Barkha Dutt?
questions.explanation: Barkha Dutt is known for investigative journalism. Media personality knowledge is vital for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: What is the term for exaggerated or misleading news stories to attract attention?
questions.explanation: Yellow journalism exaggerates news. Media ethics knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a press release?

options.text: Announce official information to the media

questions.explanation: Press releases announce information. Communication knowledge is key for Mass Communication (Public Relations).

questions.question_text: Which editing software is widely used in video production?
questions.explanation: Adobe Premiere Pro is used for video editing. Technical knowledge is vital for Mass Communication (Film Production).

questions.question_text: What is the term for a short promotional video for a product or event?
questions.explanation: Trailers promote products or events. Media production knowledge is key for Mass Communication (Advertising).

questions.question_text: What is the primary focus of media ethics?
questions.explanation: Media ethics ensures responsible reporting. Ethical knowledge is essential for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: Which Indian film director is known for socially relevant films, like Satyajit Ray?
questions.explanation: Satyajit Ray made socially relevant films. Film knowledge is vital for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: In which year was the Press Council of India established?
questions.explanation: The Press Council of India was established in 1966. Media history is relevant for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: Who founded the newspaper ‘The Hindu’ in 1878?
questions.explanation: G. Subramania Iyer founded ‘The Hindu’. Print media history is key for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: In which year was Doordarshan, India’s public broadcaster, established?
questions.explanation: Doordarshan was established in 1959. Broadcasting history is relevant for Mass Communication (Television).

questions.question_text: Who was the first Indian to win an Oscar for Best Costume Design?
questions.explanation: Bhanu Athaiya won an Oscar in 1983. Film history is key for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: In which year was the first Indian talkie film, ‘Alam Ara’, released?
questions.explanation: ‘Alam Ara’ was released in 1931. Indian cinema history is relevant for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: Who founded the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) in 1960?
questions.explanation: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting founded FTII. Institutional history is key for Mass Communication (Film Production).

questions.question_text: In which year was the first Indian television broadcast made?
questions.explanation: The first TV broadcast was in 1959 via Doordarshan. Television history is relevant for Mass Communication (Broadcasting).

questions.question_text: Who was the first editor of the newspaper ‘Kesari’, founded by Bal Gangadhar Tilak?
questions.explanation: Gopal Ganesh Agarkar was the first editor of ‘Kesari’. Print media history is key for Mass Communication (Journalism).

questions.question_text: In which year was the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) established in India?
questions.explanation: CBFC was established in 1952. Film regulation history is relevant for Mass Communication (Film Studies).

questions.question_text: Who directed the first Indian feature film, ‘Raja Harishchandra’?
questions.explanation: Dadasaheb Phalke directed ‘Raja Harishchandra’ in 1913. Indian cinema history is key for Mass Communication (Film Studies).
